unnormalised: **New Wheels Alert: What's Hot on the Indian Auto Scene!**
normalised: **New Wheels Alert: What's Hot on the Indian Auto Scene!**

unnormalised: Namaste, gearheads! Time to rev up your engines because the Indian automotive market is buzzing with new vehicle launches, and trust me, there's something for everyone, from the budget-conscious college kid to the luxury-seeking businessman.
normalised: Namaste, gearheads! Time to rev up your engines because the Indian automotive market is buzzing with new vehicle launches, and trust me, there's something for everyone, from the budget-conscious college kid to the luxury-seeking businessman.

unnormalised: First up, Tata Motors finally dropped the Altroz EV! We've been waiting ages for this, and from the initial reviews, it seems like it's worth the wait. Expect a decent range (around 300 km, they say) and all the Altroz's cool features, but with zero emissions! Great for navigating the chaotic Delhi traffic, right?
normalised: First up, Tata Motors finally dropped the Altroz E V! We've been waiting ages for this, and from the initial reviews, it seems like it's worth the wait. Expect a decent range (around three hundred kilometer, they say) and all the Altroz's cool features, but with zero emissions! Great for navigating the chaotic Delhi traffic, right?

unnormalised: Then there's Mahindra, teasing us with their new XUV900. It's supposed to be a coupe-SUV, something totally different for the Indian market. Think sporty looks and a powerful engine, perfect for those weekend getaways to Lonavala. Rumours say it'll be packed with tech, including a massive touchscreen.
normalised: Then there's Mahindra, teasing us with their new X U V nine hundred. It's supposed to be a coupe-S U V, something totally different for the Indian market. Think sporty looks and a powerful engine, perfect for those weekend getaways to Lonavala. Rumours say it'll be packed with tech, including a massive touchscreen.

unnormalised: And for those looking at something more premium, BMW launched the new 5 Series LWB (Long Wheel Base) specifically for the Indian market. More legroom for the back seat, perfect for being chauffeured around in Mumbai traffic. It'll cost you though, expect a price tag starting around Rs. 70 lakh.
normalised: And for those looking at something more premium, B M W launched the new five Series L W B (Long Wheel Base) specifically for the Indian market. More legroom for the back seat, perfect for being chauffeured around in Mumbai traffic. It'll cost you though, expect a price tag starting around rupee seventy lakh.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki isn't sitting still either. They just launched a limited edition of the Swift, calling it the "Swift Glory Edition." Nothing major, just some cosmetic tweaks and new colours, but it definitely gives the already popular hatchback a fresh look. Ideal for zipping around the narrow lanes of Chandni Chowk.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki isn't sitting still either. They just launched a limited edition of the Swift, calling it the "Swift Glory Edition." Nothing major, just some cosmetic tweaks and new colours, but it definitely gives the already popular hatchback a fresh look. Ideal for zipping around the narrow lanes of Chandni Chowk.

unnormalised: Don't forget about the EV startups! Ather Energy expanded their footprint, opening a new experience centre in Kochi, spanning over 2000 sq ft. That means more access to their electric scooters for people in Kerala.
normalised: Don't forget about the E V startups! Ather Energy expanded their footprint, opening a new experience centre in Kochi, spanning over two thousand square feet. That means more access to their electric scooters for people in Kerala.

unnormalised: Dr. Kumar, a professor at IIT Madras and automotive expert, predicts a surge in EV adoption this year. So, keep an eye out for more electric launches in the coming months! Which launch are you most excited about? Let me know in the comments! Jai Hind!
normalised: Doctor Kumar, a professor at I I T Madras and automotive expert, predicts a surge in E V adoption this year. So, keep an eye out for more electric launches in the coming months! Which launch are you most excited about? Let me know in the comments! Jai Hind!
